group_1.textRight: The northern nunnery was attacked because@they sold information...
And now it's our turn.

group_1.textLeft: W-What are you saying...@This isn't like you, wise as you usually are...

group_1.textRight: I know.
You're trying to weaken the nunnery by not@letting anyone become the Rakshasi, right?
Do you think everyone will accept that?
Let's capture the Lama!

group_1.textLeft: You should all know that these are just@baseless rumors.

group_1.textRight: Hahaha...don't you know anything@about this, Lama?

group_1.narration: "People believe what they want to believe."

group_1.textRight: ...Even if they know it's a lie.
Tie him up! I'll go restrain the other monks.
Are you going to take everyone down?@He was part of your group!

group_1.textLeft: Of course! They used us for their own benefit.
We don't need any more corrupt adults@in this nunnery.

group_1.narration: "This is our Shambhala."
Many junior nuns gathered around Dolma and@followed her instructions to tie up the Lama.
To obey Dolma's words without suspicion@like this... they probably spread bad rumors@about the Lama beforehand.
And once they became her allies and an@opportunity presented itself, they wanted@to take control of this nunnery...

group_1.textRight: Heruka, were you watching?

group_1.textLeft: ...Dolma, what are you doing?@Why are you doing this?

group_1.textRight: What am I doing...?@I'm going to become the Rakshasi.
I will perform the Rakshasi ritual@and receive power.
It's okay, don't worry. I'll protect you.

group_1.narration: It's not you protecting me...@it's me protecting you...!

group_1.textRight: Ah, Heruka...!
Let's keep searching!

group_1.narration: Just moments ago, the adults who were regarded@as our teachers were now being chased.
They intend to capture them and bring them to Lord Jataka,@but that's impossible to begin with...
Even the Lama can't meet Lord Jataka properly.
...Doing something like this won't change anything.@In fact, it will only lead to unnecessary suffering and sadness,@which we should avoid.
To me, it seems that Dolma will be unable to@find Lord Jataka, and will lose her influence.@She will end up as everyone's scapegoat,@leading to a miserable end.
I have such a premonition.
I've resolved to protect Dolma,@so I must prevent that from happening.
If I can't protect her this time,@I will truly become nothing...
I thought someone I didn't know was calling me,@but it turned out to be another junior nun from@a different nunnery I had helped during the day...@She was from the northern nunnery.
In addition to her, other junior nuns from@that same place began to appear.

group_1.textRight: What in the world is happening?

group_1.narration: To sum it up briefly,@she had a complicated expression on her face@as I explained the situation.
Having just been saved and immediately dragged@into internal troubles like this must have@made her want to sigh...

group_1.textRight: I see. We'll help too.
You're going to take action to restore@the nunnery, right?
Please let us repay the favor.

group_1.narration: It seemed like they misunderstood me.
I didn't help them out of a sense of justice or duty.
I did it because I thought if I left them alone,@Dolma would be in danger.
Dolma wants to become a Rakshasi...@So she imposes a sense of specialness on herself,@hoping to take heroic actions...
That's why I'm trying to stop her.@I just feel that way.
...But why do they look at me with eyes@that see me as something special?
In the distance, I saw several flickering lights.@Those were torches carried by people...
I understood right away that the Mongolian soldiers@from earlier had returned with reinforcements.
In other words, they were planning a@full-scale attack on the town.

group_1.textRight: ...What should we do?@We'll follow you.

group_1.textLeft: Isn't it better to run away?

group_1.textRight: I think it's more likely to work out@if we follow you.

group_1.narration: But...we have to confront them.@Otherwise, I won't be able to protect Dolma.

group_1.textCenter: I may not be anything special, but...
